choices.D: You can't pivot within a row to Causality view and Timeline views
choices.C: Using the Open Card and Open Timeline actions respectively

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Open Card is for Causality View
Open Timeline is for Timeline View

"C" is the right answer here

choices.A: Failure to restore access to systems undermines the scheme because others will not believe their valuables would be returned.
choices.B: The ransomware attackers hope to trace the financial trail back and steal more from traditional banking institutions.
choices.C: There is organized crime governance among attackers that requires the return of access to remain in good standing.
choices.D: Nation-states enforce the return of system access through the use of laws and regulation.

questions.question_text: What motivation do ransomware attackers have for returning access to systems once their victims have paid?
What is the WildFire analysis file size limit for Windows PE files?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Cortex XSIAM sends unknown samples for in-depth analysis to WildFire. WildFire accepts up to 1,000,000 sample uploads per day and up to 1,000,000 verdict queries per day from each Cortex XDR tenant. The daily limit resets at 23:59:00 UTC. Uploads that exceed the sample limit are queued for analysis after the limit resets. WildFire also limits sample sizes to 100MB.

Correct answer is B

 WildFire also limits sample sizes to 100MB.
https://docs-cortex.paloaltonetworks.com/r/Cortex-XDR/Cortex-XDR-Prevent-Administrator-Guide/WildFire-Analysis-Concepts

Selected Answer: B
b looks the best

Selected Answer: A
UASLR (User Address Space Layout Randomization): UASLR increases the entropy of memory address randomization, which helps in making it more difficult for attackers to predict memory locations. By randomizing the locations of data and executable code in memory, UASLR significantly improves security against attacks that rely on knowing or guessing memory addresses, such as buffer overflow attacks.

Correct answer is A. 

UASLR

Improves or altogether implements ASLR (address space layout randomization) with greater entropy, robustness, and strict enforcement.
https://docs-cortex.paloaltonetworks.com/r/Cortex-XDR/Cortex-XDR-Prevent-Administrator-Guide/Endpoint-Protection-Modules

Selected Answer: A
A looks the best

questions.question_text: Which Exploit Prevention Module (EPM) provides better entropy for randomization of memory locations?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B - It does not need to interfere with any portion of the pattern to prevent the attack.

Source: PCDRA Sample Questions

https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/content/dam/pan/en_US/assets/pdf/datasheets/education/pcdra-sample-questions.pdf

Selected Answer: C
I think B is misleading the answer should be C.
B says "does not interfere" implying it never does.
C says "does not NEED to interfere" implying it doesn't have to, but can if needed.

Selected Answer: B
almost same wording as #42 of these questions. I still think it is B based on the evidence provided for the other question.

choices.C: It does not need to interfere with the any portion of the pattern to prevent the attack.
choices.B: It does not interfere with any portion of the pattern on the endpoint.
choices.D: It interferes with the pattern as soon as it is observed by the firewall.
choices.A: It interferes with the pattern as soon as it is observed on the endpoint.

questions.question_text: To stop a network-based attack, any interference with a portion of the attack pattern is enough to prevent it from succeeding. Which statement is correct regarding the Cortex XDR Analytics module?
